questions.text: Qaysi variant gapni grammatik jihatdan to‘g‘ri yakunlaydi? “I ____ in Tashkent since 2021.”
To‘g‘ri artikl(lar)ni tanlang: “We visited ___ British Museum and had ___ lunch nearby.”
Qaysi variant ma’noga mos? “If it ___ tomorrow, we’ll stay at home.”
Bo‘sh joyni to‘ldiring: “I’m not used ___ late on weekdays.”
Qaysi gap passiv nisbatda?

options.A: They built a new bridge last year.
options.B: They are building a new bridge.
options.C: A new bridge was built last year.
options.D: They have to build a new bridge.

questions.text: To‘g‘ri so‘roq shaklini tanlang: “___ she finished her homework yet?”
To‘g‘ri predlogni tanlang: “I’m interested ___ learning Python.”
Mos variantni tanlang: “This exercise is ___ than the previous one.”
Bo‘sh joyni to‘ldiring: “She said that she ___ tired.”
Qaysi gapda ‘too’ va ‘enough’ to‘g‘ri ishlatilgan?

options.A: It’s enough cold to wear a coat.
options.B: It’s too cold to go swimming.
options.C: She is enough tall to play basketball.

questions.text: Bo‘sh joyni to‘ldiring: “I wish I ___ more time to study.”
Qaysi variant qarindosh (relative) bog‘lovchidan to‘g‘ri foydalangan?

options.A: The man which lives next door is a doctor.
options.B: The book who I borrowed was interesting.
options.C: The city where I was born is small.
options.D: That is the reason why I happy.

questions.text: Bo‘sh joyni to‘ldiring: “She ___ to the gym three times a week.”
Qaysi qo‘shma fe’l (phrasal verb) mos keladi? “Please ___ the lights before you leave.”
Bo‘sh joyni to‘ldiring: “He asked me if I ___ come earlier.”
Modal fe’lni tanlang: “You ___ wear a helmet. It’s the rule.”
Bo‘sh joyni to‘ldiring: “There aren’t ___ chairs for everyone.”
Qaysi gapda xatolik bor?

options.B: She don’t go to school on Sundays.
options.D: We have already finished the task.

questions.text: Bo‘sh joyni to‘ldiring (comparative + than): “This road is ___ than that one.”
Qaysi variant ‘for/since’ to‘g‘ri qo‘llangan?

options.B: I have known her since two years.
options.D: I have known her for I was a child.

questions.text: Bo‘sh joyni to‘ldiring: “By the time we arrived, the film ___.”
Qaysi gapda infinitive maqsadni bildiradi?
Bo‘sh joyni to‘ldiring: “We were tired, so we decided ___ a taxi.”
Qaysi variant to‘g‘ri so‘z tartibida? (adverb of frequency)

options.A: He goes always to work by bus.
options.B: He always goes to work by bus.
options.C: Always he goes to work by bus.
options.D: He goes to work by bus always.

questions.text: To‘g‘ri variant: “This is the place ___ we first met.”
Bo‘sh joyni to‘ldiring: “I’d rather ___ at home tonight.”
Qaysi gapda ‘some/any’ to‘g‘ri ishlatilgan?
Bo‘sh joyni to‘ldiring: “She speaks English ___ than me.”
Qaysi variant parallel tuzilmani saqlaydi?

options.A: He likes reading, to swim, and jogging.
options.B: He likes to read, swimming, and to jog.
options.C: He likes reading, swimming, and jogging.
options.D: He likes to reading, swimming, and jogging.

questions.text: Bo‘sh joyni to‘ldiring: “By next year, I ___ my driving test.”

references.1: ‘since 2021’ davomiyligini bildiradi; Present Perfect: have/has + past participle → “have lived”.
references.2: Maxsus nomlangan muzey uchun ‘the’; ‘lunch’ odatda artiklsiz umumiy ma’noda ishlatiladi.
references.3: 1‑shart (First Conditional): if‑clause’da Present Simple, natijada ‘will + V’.
references.4: ‘be used to’ + noun/gerund; shu yerda gerund ‘staying’ kerak.
references.5: “was built” – Past Simple Passive (be + past participle).
references.6: Present Perfect bilan ‘Has/Have + subject + past participle’; ‘yet’ ko‘pincha P.Perfect bilan.
references.8: Ikki narsani qiyoslashda ko‘p bo‘g‘inli sifatlar bilan ‘more + adj’.
references.9: Reported speech’da orqaga siljish: Present → Past (‘is’ → ‘was’).
references.10: ‘too + adj + to‑inf’; ‘adj + enough’ emas, ‘enough’ sifatdan keyin kelmaydi bu tuzilmada.
references.11: Hozirgi haqiqiy holatga afsus bildirganda ‘wish + Past Simple’: “I wish I had …”.
references.12: Joylar bilan ‘where’; odamlar ‘who/that’; narsalar ‘which/that’. ‘why’ + reason to‘g‘ri, lekin ‘I am happy’ kerak.
references.15: Reported yes/no question’da zamon orqaga siljishi: ‘can’ → ‘could’.
references.21: O‘tgan vaqtda ‘by the time’ – Past Perfect: ‘had started’.
references.22: ‘stop to do’ – maqsad uchun to‘xtamoq; ‘stop doing’ – faoliyatni to‘xtatmoq.
references.24: ‘always’ odatda asosiy fe’l oldidan: ‘He always goes …’.
references.27: Inkorda va savolda ko‘pincha ‘any’; tasdiqda ‘some’. ‘Do you have any minutes?’ odatda ‘any’ bilan.
references.29: Parallelizm: bir xil grammatik shakl – gerund + gerund + gerund.
references.30: Kelajakdagi muayyan vaqtdan oldin yakun: Future Perfect – ‘will have + V3’.
